Uses of Class
dkeep.logic.CellPosition

    • Uses of CellPosition in dkeep.logic

      Methods in dkeep.logic that return CellPosition 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CellPosition Ogre.getAttack()
      This method returns the ogre's last attack.
      CellPosition Game.getGuardPosition()
      This method returns the guard's position
      CellPosition Game.getHeroPosition()
      This method returns the hero's position
      CellPosition Game.getLeverPosition()
      This method returns the lever/key's position
      CellPosition Unit.getPosition()
      This method returns the unit's position.
      Methods in dkeep.logic with parameters of type CellPosition 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char GameMap.getCharOnPos(CellPosition Pos)
      Returns char that contains the information on a given position (as a parameter) of the map
      char Game.getMapChar(CellPosition pos)
      This method returns a specific element of the map.
      boolean Game.HeroCaught(CellPosition Guard_or_OgrePos, CellPosition HeroPos)
      This method checks if the hero is near a deadly enemy (ogre swing or guard).
      void GameMap.openDoors(boolean isKey, CellPosition heroiPos)
      If there's a key and this the hero tries to move against a closed door with it, the function opens that door and all the doors adjacent to it recursively If there's a lever, when the hero pushes it, all of the outer doors open
      void Ogre.setAttack(CellPosition attack)
      This method changes the position of the attack.
      void GameMap.setCharOnPos(CellPosition Pos, char Representation)
      Set a given char on a given position of the map
      void GameMap.setUnitPosMap(CellPosition position_to_set, CellPosition position_to_erase, char representation)
      Set a char on a given position of the map and erases a char (replaces it with ' ') on a given position
